NewWords.WordPhrase: a. added; extra 附加的，另外的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. An additional charge is made for heavy bags.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be attractive or interesting to (sb.) 有吸引力，使感兴趣
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The book will appeal only to a very limited public.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ask to come to help in a difficult situation 叫…进来，召来
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We had no hesitation in calling in the police.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. undertake, carry out 从事，进行；主持
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's conducted the firm's financial affairs for years.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. face (sth.) and try to deal with it 勇敢地面对，正视
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We must confront the future with optimism.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (crises) n. time of great danger or difficulty 危机
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We hope we can survive this time of crisis.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. fact, circumstance, etc. that helps to produce a result 因素
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His friendly manner is a factor in his rapid success.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. of an earlier time 以前的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She's back to her former self again.

NewWords.WordPhrase: it's one's view 在…看来，…认为
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In the financial controller's opinion, a raise in salary will increase the total cost.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. cause (sb.) to take part in sth.; include 使卷入，使参与；包括
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Several high ranking officials were involved in the scandal.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. 天生地，天然地
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She was naturally shy.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 自己选择的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. You may either accept or reject his proposal, anyway it's all of your own choice.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (plan for a) scheme or undertaking 计划；规划；工程
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The government has begun a project to increase the size of the harbor.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 范围；幅度；一系列
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The subject is outside my range.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. connect, associate 将…联系起来
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I related his bad mood to a lack of sleep.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. provide a substitute for (sb./sth.) 更换
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. These tires are badly worn and should be replaced.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. find a solution to (sth.) 解决
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They have resolved most of their difficulties.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. choose 选择
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Which of them did you select for the job?

NewWords.WordPhrase: undertake; decide to do 从事，承担
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He agreed to take on the new job.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. very large or great 巨大的，极大的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The storm caused a tremendous amount of damage.
